tweet:
ALS is a terrible disease still waiting for a cure. As ALS Caucus Co-chair with @SenatorBraun, I advocate for expanding research and treatment options for those with ALS. 

To raise awareness for our efforts, Senator Braun and I hope to designate this May as #ALSAwarenessMonth https://t.co/yC6EF4oZDG

The Justice Department’s decision to drop the criminal case against Michael Flynn, President Trump’s former National Security Advisor, is a new low point for the rule of law in this country. ⬇️THREAD https://t.co/JM1rEEDeRp

During #COVID19, nonprofits are helping to feed and support vulnerable people in our communities. But nonprofits are struggling financially too and need financial support from generous Americans more than ever.
Thank you for your tireless leadership, @annmaura! We’re proud to partner with you to #Stand4Service https://t.co/xgMruaPhhy
#Stand4Service https://t.co/wx77Uco1VZ

Our bold new legislation to expand @AmeriCorps will help communities across the country respond and recover from #COVID19. It’s been an inspiring group effort to make this plan a reality. #Stand4Service https://t.co/Dry5eVrtHo

Now is the time to #Stand4Service. 

The U.S. needs an army of workers to deliver meals & supplies & help with virtual learning, contact tracing, and more. We have a locally-driven plan to get there.
https://t.co/A133v6rJui
Thank you, @PeteButtigieg! #NationalServiceWorks and with so many Americans in need, now is the time to expand it. https://t.co/cbcEgTrHcW

It's National Teacher Appreciation Week! Amid this health crisis, our teachers have stepped up to continue educating kids across our country, & we could not be more grateful. I’m glad to see one of Delaware’s best, @MrsKeziahFinney, still bringing fun to the (virtual) classroom. https://t.co/r5f1kj06Sw

We’ve got a generation of Americans eager to serve our country and help our communities recover. What are we waiting for?

Let's expand @AmeriCorps to respond to #COVID19.

#NationalServiceWorks https://t.co/sZipVIrGSY

Powerful and important read from @nytdavidbrooks: "We Need National Service. Now."
 
I agree. As Brooks writes, "There is now a vast army of young people ready and yearning to serve their country." Let's expand national service so they can help meet the urgencies of this moment. https://t.co/Gjr5LH2zvG
We need to activate American manufacturing so that the American supply chain can efficiently deliver PPE, diagnostic equipment, and – eventually – a COVID-19 vaccine. https://t.co/luW5HeEl7G

MUST READ: "If states and the federal government don’t do more to help voters in November — starting now, with urgency — the barriers for some of them may be insurmountable." The time is now to make #votebymail an option for every voter.
https://t.co/lT4QqYIZ3C

I'm a Democrat and @BillKristol is a lifelong conservative, but we agree that coronavirus denialism from President Trump and too many Republicans in Congress will hurt our economy and cost American lives. @usatodayopinion https://t.co/yWQvwCyEzQ

We cannot afford to be caught flat-footed in the next pandemic. 

Important read by Judge Paul Michel on how our nation’s patent system – once the world’s “gold standard” – no longer incentivizes research and development of medical diagnostics and tests. https://t.co/If7HTozL7N
Women should have access to birth control, and that access shouldn’t depend on getting their boss’s permission. https://t.co/wHcgGLwOed
The same day that Justin Walker interviewed at the White House with Donald Trump and Mitch McConnell, the CDC issued an alert advising that it was monitoring an outbreak in Wuhan, China.

#ThankYouNurses today and every day for fighting to keep us safe and healthy. As we mark #NationalNursesDay during this pandemic, we thank you for your hard work, dedication to patients, and bravery on the front lines. https://t.co/x0pkYpHYxW

“We can’t spend our way out of our problems, but we can serve our way out of them together”

A great read from @AnnMaura and @ericjtanenblatt on how national service can deliver the #COVID19 response we need. #NationalServiceWorks
https://t.co/i5PMFsN4MM

We can emerge from this crisis stronger than before by promoting American innovation. Evidence continues to mount that our bipartisan, bicameral FORWARD Act will support more R&D—especially at startups. Read more from @ITIFdc here: https://t.co/VBxtPGhWYX https://t.co/9WhvdKGmYT

We should – in the middle of a health care and an economic crisis – not be having a hearing on a partisan judicial nominee for a vacancy that won’t even be available for 119 days. In the last 119 days, a quarter million people have died around the world in the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/c61THoSItk
From home and socially-distanced, be sure to check out the C-17 fly-by in a show of appreciation for our COVID-19 responders and health care heroes! #DoverAFBSalutes #netde https://t.co/qfgLHRCjqW

I’m stepping into a Judiciary Committee hearing for Justin Walker – an under-qualified nominee being rushed to the D.C. Circuit. The Senate should be focused on relief to workers & small businesses, but Leader McConnell has instead set an agenda of rubberstamping partisan judges. https://t.co/mWybiS5Bbv

We have a ready, diverse pool of returned @PeaceCorps volunteers, current @AmeriCorps members, and hundreds of thousands of Americans who previously applied with AmeriCorps.
 
We should mobilize them to provide the pandemic response we need.
https://t.co/HONGopHoCR

On this #GivingTuesday, I’d like to thank all of the #nonprofits in Delaware and across the country serving on the front lines and providing critical services during the #COVID19 pandemic! I’ll continue to fight for support to nonprofits in future coronavirus relief legislation.
Congress has been working to support workers, families, small businesses and nonprofits. I want to give you an update on where we are in implementing the latest stimulus bill. https://t.co/zyiPQSlhmg

NEW: Today, we formally introduced the Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act to tap into our ready-made national service network with @AmeriCorps to respond to the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/z0TwJgZzsx

Justin Walker is a threat to health care access nationwide, and 53 groups are urging the Senate to #StopWalker from being confirmed to the D.C. Circuit.

Beyond his inexperience, he opposes the ACA. Senate Republicans should not rubberstamp this nomination. #CourtsMatter. https://t.co/AjpuR1LuPe
Tomorrow – instead of deliberating on a COVID-19 response – Mitch McConnell has set a Senate agenda that focuses on rushing a hearing on an inexperienced and partisan nominee to the D.C. Circuit.

Amid a pandemic, Leader McConnell has brought the Senate into session – not to deliberate on oversight & the federal response to COVID-19, but to rush through an under-qualified judicial nomination for a seat that won’t even be open until September.  
https://t.co/sWSTlyg2sv

NEW: Today, I introduced bipartisan, bicameral legislation to support American R&D by:
✅ Strengthening the R&D credit for startups that innovate
✅ Incentivizing American manufacturing
✅ Promoting worker training
May the 4th be with you. Happy #StarWarsDay https://t.co/f6OlhP5DTu

COVID-19 is severely disrupting meat production operations including chicken facilities in Delaware. I’m urging the @USDA to work closely with poultry producers to deliver the support they need to keep workers safe. https://t.co/yGc3Btecpr

REMINDER – If you receive VA or SSI benefits and haven’t filed a tax return since 2017, you have until May 5 to claim dependents under 17 for the extra $500 recovery rebate.
Enter your info HERE: https://t.co/jubRJkm7iD https://t.co/u1I2qrE91H

Developing a vaccine is one thing, but if we’re going to produce hundreds of millions of doses by next year, we *have* to expand our domestic manufacturing capacity. The U.S. is not prepared to manufacture 300 million doses. Other countries are. https://t.co/5LfL5xaTwl

We need to be planning ahead to prevent #COVID19 from disrupting our elections. I’m calling for additional funding to states to allow all eligible voters to have the option to #votebymail this November.
https://t.co/038HEqdKSe

The Pandemic Response and Opportunity Through National Service Act would double the national service positions available today to help us respond & recover from #COVID19. These individuals could serve in communities across the country providing meals, education assistance & more. https://t.co/Mm9cgUbTU1

National service volunteers around the country are on the front lines of this pandemic: delivering food, assisting healthcare workers, and providing aid to communities in need. Programs like @AmeriCorps are vital to helping our country respond & rebuild. #NationalServiceWorks

We need relief to reach the families hit hardest by the COVID-19 pandemic and economic crisis. My Senate colleagues and I are urging Leaders Schumer and McConnell to expand two tax credits that put money in the pockets of American families. https://t.co/xXfwHkqEpz

Health care workers are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic.  I’m glad to work with @sendavidperdue, @SenatorDurbin, & @SenToddYoung on bipartisan legislation to target doctors and nurses in the green card backlog for relief, so Americans can get the urgent care they need.

Communities of color in the U.S. are facing a disproportionate impact of COVID-19. We’re seeing the deadly outcomes of this inequality in medical access and work conditions, so we must redouble our efforts to support the communities most in need. https://t.co/s5xIEvHo3D

The bipartisan Senate #ClimateSolutionsCaucus had a great meeting - from a distance - tonight with @Microsoft President Brad Smith to discuss the company’s commitments to reduce emissions, invest in new carbon reduction technologies, and protect the world’s ecosystems.

Pleased to see the @federalreserve announcement that its Paycheck Protection Program Liquidity Facility will now be accessible to community development financial institutions (CDFIs)! https://t.co/B73FlcBdpZ

I agree that now is the time for national service. I have a proposal that would double the number of @AmeriCorps positions available—providing young people the opportunity to help our communities recover all while building skills, being paid, & earning funds for higher education. https://t.co/vdJDQL9U9g
This evening, I would have joined @CFSIUpdate for their annual event to recognize the work of fire and emergency personnel to keep communities safe across the country. https://t.co/haMgjeQB5v

There is absolutely no place for racism, hatred, and bigotry in our politics – I condemn this cowardly action in the strongest possible terms. 
Delaware’s diversity is our strength & I’m proud to stand with the Delaware Legislative Black Caucus & @RepLBR.
https://t.co/SLKk4YSriA

Childcare providers are stepping up and working hard to support families amid COVID-19. I‘m joining @SenTinaSmith and @SenWarren to fight for emergency funding and long-term support for the childcare industry in the next stimulus relief package. https://t.co/L1Gcvo96Xj

In the middle of a pandemic, Mitch McConnell is forcing senators – & hundreds more in staff & Capitol employees – to travel to the Capitol, not to work on the #COVID19 response, but simply to force another right-wing judicial nominee to the federal bench. https://t.co/aicdNoygYp

Without immediate action, SBA’s flagship lending program will shut down, denying small businesses struggling from the pandemic the ability to access an emergency relief provision I authored as part of the CARES Act. My colleagues & I are urging @SBAgov to swiftly resolve this. https://t.co/2xaYDbmVWf

We should be doing everything we can to limit the spread of the virus as health officials warn of continued spread of #COVID19 through the fall. I’m calling for $3.6B in funds to ensure voters can #votebymail or vote early ahead of November.
https://t.co/K0engtiqJj
All across the nation, we need a coordinated public health response. National service can make that possible. #NationalServiceWorks. https://t.co/h6H0PiuNX6
The lack of a clear, coordinated national supply chain strategy to help frontline health care workers respond to this pandemic is creating chaos and likely costing lives.

We should double the number of @AmeriCorps volunteers serving today to build a national workforce of 150,000 people that can provide the pandemic response we need. #NationalServiceWorks https://t.co/ct9m21bKUd

“We can rebuild better.” Thanks, @AmbassadorRice, for recognizing that our ready-made #NationalService network can and should play a transformative role in the #COVID19 response.
https://t.co/XZAkWq8Qk6

Today is #TrueColorsDay, a day for raising awareness and taking action to end LGBTQ youth homelessness. Up to 40% of youth experiencing homelessness are LGBTQ. In the Senate, I will continue to work to end youth homelessness so that all young people have a place to call home.
Glad to have you on board, @TeachForAmerica! #NationalService programs are critical to our #COVID19 response & recovery. We should expand their role! https://t.co/LY9Fs2DJW3

Thank you for your support, @ServiceYear! More and more service groups are telling us what we already know: our ready-made network for #NationalService can and should play a key role in responding to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/qmvpTiwBKC

So many of us have loved ones in long term care facilities right now, so let’s all recognize the brave work of health care providers on the front lines and the challenges faced by residents as they are separated from family and loved ones. I’m thinking of you today and every day. https://t.co/NaK279zb8y

Community financial institutions are in desperate need of capital to continue lending to small businesses in underserved areas.
https://t.co/Pm9aXQhwXu

Domestic violence survivors need greater support amid stay-at-home orders, so I’m working with my colleagues in Congress to help. Along with @SenCortezMasto, I’m urging congressional leaders to support programs that provide critical housing support for survivors. https://t.co/Nw6W9xCIag

Today I spoke with Michelle, Delaware's Direct Support Professional of the Year! She works every day with Delawareans with disabilities in Newark and makes an amazing difference for her community and our state. Thank you for all that you and your colleagues do! https://t.co/NtDM64nsOv

Experts expect we may need up to 300,000 people nationwide to serve as #COVID19 contact tracers to help safely re-open our economy. That’s why I’m calling to expand existing #NationalService programs like @Americorps to meet the needs of this moment. 
https://t.co/pK97lOipSf
ICYMI: Kentucky announced that every registered voter can #votebymail for the upcoming primary. https://t.co/fvPWKSYOwp

I’ve been hearing from hospitals across Delaware about the need for telehealth expansion support. I’m glad that this program will soon support vulnerable, low-income patients in Delaware. Thank you to @AjitPaiFCC & @FCC for their support on this program. https://t.co/Gq3czkJDZy
“By World War II, every state let soldiers vote remotely and the military was responsible for about 3.2 million absentee ballots cast.” https://t.co/H0r8WVKFhT

We should be helping states carry out safe & secure 2020 elections. I stand with @SenatorBennet & @SenatorCollins in calling for the urgent removal of the 20% funding match tied to the election funding in the CARES Act, so every state can prepare for November. https://t.co/fIw1iovNXV

Global investments to #EndMalaria—largely thanks to bipartisan U.S. leadership—save nearly 600K lives a year compared to 2000 levels. With #COVID19 spreading to malaria-affected nations, urgent action is needed to continue saving lives & protect progress. #WorldMalariaDay https://t.co/HxlbZU1pnI

Here's the problem: Other countries are prepared to manufacture a #COVID19 vaccine quickly & at scale; the US is not.

We cannot rely solely on countries like China for ingredients, supplies, or vaccine production. We need to improve our manufacturing capacity here at home.

Service is bringing Delawareans together in a difficult time. At the @FoodBankofDE mobile pantry events, I was inspired to see so many people leading by example and supporting their neighbors. Thanks to everyone for their acts of service during this National Volunteer Week. https://t.co/H05Ztc5Vtv

Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, prisoners of conscience such as journalists, non-violent activists, & artists continue to be detained unjustly overseas. Many, due to age or health, are especially vulnerable to COVID-19 as it spreads through detention facilities. That’s unacceptable.

Happy Afterschool Professionals Appreciation Week! Thank you @DelawareASN for the profound impact you make in the lives of young people. I'm grateful for the work of dedicated afterschool leaders who support our students and serve our communities. You are the #HeartOfAfterschool! https://t.co/eEZt9P1axO

To those observing in the United States and across the world, my family and I wish you a blessed month of Ramadan.  Ramadan Mubarak! https://t.co/PV3ddXCHpS

The #COVID19 pandemic is a crisis facing the entire country, & part of the federal response must be to help states prepare to hold elections in this new environment.

We need a bold new plan for national service to meet the needs of this moment. 

Today, I announced new legislation to expand national service programs to aid our response & recovery efforts amid #COVID19. https://t.co/fPOe9avfUo

From bold climate action to the fight to protect wildlife, we still have work ahead to address environmental issues around the world and here at home. 

As we celebrate 50 years of #EarthDay, I’m inspired by people around the world uniting to protect our planet. https://t.co/3q8SPMj36w
We need to act now to ensure that every eligible American can safely exercise their right to vote this November. #votebymail #earlyvoting https://t.co/Swcd45P8ln

Today, I joined @AnnMaura Connolly of @Voices4Service to call for a bold expansion of national service programs to respond to #COVID19. We have a ready-made national network of individuals who, if we engage them, can be a critical pandemic response corps in this time of crisis.

The Senate just voted unanimously to pass nearly $500B in new relief – this will help expand COVID-19 testing nationwide, get more than $370B in aid to small businesses, and help our hospitals and health systems on the front lines. https://t.co/4cNxFQLxrb

So many people are experiencing need during the #COVID19 pandemic. We must come together to support one another in times like this. 

I am proud to see Delawareans leading by example each day as we confront COVID-19 head on, together. 
https://t.co/CjicQMan2H

This is unacceptable. We need to ensure that every eligible American has the opportunity to #votebymail or vote early during this pandemic. Crowded polling places in Wisconsin placed people’s lives at risk. https://t.co/kSIOa8hkfn
